results.title: It's all been great!
results.brief_description:
Wayne is not only a playing member of the local BBC Bowling Club but he also plays tennis and captains a basketball team. Here he speaks of his various achievements, his love of sport and particularly his love for his family.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: James Dean: the rare movies
results.creator_credit: Justis Addiss, Don Medford, William Self, Mort Abrahams, Martin Horrell, Meridan and Management Corporation of America
results.brief_description: These three teleplays, produced in 1953, 1954 and 1955 display James Dean’s mastery of playing the young angst-ridden loner who longs for a better life for himself. “Something for an empty briefcase”: A young drifter and ex-jailbird pines to be a respectable gentleman in life, the type who carries a briefcase to work, instead of a thief. One night he meets a young dancer who displays to him that it is possible to live with passion for life, not just for money. “The unlighted road”: Jeffrey is an ex-army serviceman drifting from small town to small town hoping to find a connection somewhere or with something. One night he is offered a job in a diner but suspects foul play amidst some of the more seedy customers. When Jeffrey falls for a local girl, their future together is threatened by his boss’ dodgy dealings. “I’m a fool”: an older man laments his youthful folly when as a simple farm boy he put on false airs and graces in order to win the attention of the lovely and sophisticated Lucy. Also stars: Natalie Wood. All three short films retain the advertisements from the show’s sponsor inserted at intermission.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Justis Addiss, Don Medford, William Self, Mort Abrahams, Martin Horrell, Meridan and Management Corporation of America

results.brief_description: This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope. results.title: Monkeys, apes and man: exploring the chasm
results.creator_credit: Jeff Myrow, Wolper Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Explains how studies of primate social organisation, use and manufacture of tools, ability to learn, and socialisation, have shown that the similarity between monkeys and humans is not superficial.

results.title: Montgomery Clift: the prince
results.creator_credit: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
A documentary incorporating footage of Montgomery Clift’s most memorable films; interviews with family and with friends of Clift (including Jane Fonda); and rare archival material stretching back to his childhood. What develops is the story of an intense young boy who yearned for stardom, achieved notable success in such classic films as “From Here to Eternity” and “I Confess”, only to be ruined by alcohol addiction and his inability to face his own fears and homosexual desires. Montgomery Clift, as this video portrays him, may have not been a happy man but he never compromised his acting talents for Hollywood.

results.title: Me and Chillelax
results.brief_description:
Helen lives at home with her parents but attends the WATCH centre (Waverley Adult Training Centre for the Handicapped) every day. It is through WATCH that Helen participates in a variety of educational and creative activities, has found new friends and now enjoys a social life outside her family home.
This project was funded by the Department of Human Services, (Eastern Metropolitan Region), developed and executed in partnership with MetroAccess at the City of Monash and City of Whitehorse, and Scope.

results.title: James Dean
results.creator_credit: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
James Dean was a 1950s icon whose image fought against all that was wrong with the adult world: displacement of the young, repression, and general uncoolness. This documentary however focuses on James Dean the man, rather than his image. It is an illuminating look at the actor’s life seen through the eyes of friends, family and work colleagues. The testimonials are frank and thought provoking, and there is rare footage of TV commercials and telemovies that Dean had featured in. It shows an extremely talented and ambitious actor who often seemed more comfortable on stage or in front of a camera than he did being himself. Refreshingly it also highlights other sides to Dean such as his wicked sense of humour. The interviewees speak candidly and articulately of stories that are not a staple of the James Dean myth, leaving one with a real sense of whom this young man was as an actor.

results.title: Monkey: eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Yusuke Watanabe, Ken Mumagaya, Kazuo Morikawa, Yoji Katori, Tadahiro Nagatomi, Muneo Yamada, Tsuneo Hayakawa, Kokusai Hoei and Nihon Terebi
results.brief_description: Monkey swallows the universe - Tripitaka and Sandy get into a fix. Pigsy is bewitched by a beautiful woman and Monkey finds himself in trouble again as they enter the land ruled by the demonic Golden Horn and his wife, Silver Horn. “The Power of youth” - Tripitaka is kidnapped by the King of Youth to attract the attention of Heaven and Earth. With Sandy and Pigsy busy, it is left to Monkey to save his friend. “Even monsters can be people” - after killing a girl and her parents, Monkey is sent away by Tripitaka despite swearing they were really demons in disguise. The pilgrims realise that Monkey was telling the truth, but his failure to believe Monkey leaves Tripitaka in danger. All episodes are dubbed in English.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yusuke Watanabe, Ken Mumagaya, Kazuo Morikawa, Yoji Katori, Tadahiro Nagatomi, Muneo Yamada, Tsuneo Hayakawa, Kokusai Hoei and Nihon Terebi
